title: History
subtitle: The Development Journey of Korean Community Workers Network

timeline.title: Establishment of KWCN
timeline.description: Founded to support networking and mutual assistance among Korean community workers. Started with 20 founding members who shared a common vision.

timeline.title: First Annual Conference
timeline.description: Hosted the first annual conference to improve Korean community services. Over 100 community workers participated in this milestone event.

timeline.title: Education Program Launch
timeline.description: Launched a systematic education program for new community workers. A mentoring system was also introduced to support professional development.

timeline.title: Government Partnership
timeline.description: Established official partnerships with local governments, significantly improving the quality of Korean community services.

timeline.title: Online Platform Launch
timeline.description: Launched an online resource platform for members, enhancing information sharing and networking opportunities.

timeline.title: Pandemic Response Program
timeline.description: Rapidly developed and operated emergency support programs for the Korean community during the COVID-19 pandemic.

timeline.title: Digital Innovation
timeline.description: Introduced new community service models utilizing AI and digital technology to provide more efficient support services.

timeline.title: Next Generation Leadership
timeline.description: Expanded leadership development programs for younger generations and established foundations for sustainable community development.

mission.title: Mission
mission.description: To contribute to the welfare and development of the Korean community through enhancing professionalism and networking among Korean community workers, and to promote mutual understanding and cooperation in a multicultural society.

vision.title: Vision
vision.description: To serve as a bridge connecting Koreans and mainstream society, creating an environment where all Koreans are respected and can succeed through professional and sustainable community services.
